description: Top floor of the galleria. $9 for a hot plate of food which is two proteins and two sides. The food is microwaved after you decide what you want. I was surprised by it but I rather have warm food than cold. For the price it's a great portion. Food is not the most tastiest but acceptable. service is very friendly.
author: Kristie D.

description: This place is amazing.... I got the Breakfast Burrito.... a first for me... so good.... the OJ was fresh too.... Rachel got the Pancakes... again really nice and good maple syrup. I'll be back before we head home.
author: William T.

description: I like this place mainly due to the salad bar - but it also has a lunch buffet. Get in and get out quickly and sit in the city center enjoying your lunch and people watc
author: Louis M.

description:
Looks really clean and the prices for the area are very reasonable! It is located on the top floor of the Crocker Galleria. The staff are really friendly and the food may take a while because it's made to order but it's worth it. They have plenty of seating as well.

I got the ham and cheese omelette with tomatoes added. Substituted the hash browns for fruit. That was one of the best breakfasts I had in this area.. the fruit was sweet and fresh!!! 

I will definitely return!!!
author: Ayana K.

description:
OK spot in my eyes. The huge plus is the fact that they serve breakfast at all times of the day! So if you're having one of those days where all you want is breakfast at 2 PM this is your spot. Their portions are also pretty big.

They obviously have other items on the menu - salads, burgers, sandwiches, and even crepes.

Nothing out of the ordinary.
author: Inci A.

description:
This place is the spot for breakfast. And an answer to prayers if you happen to have a hangover but have to work.

They serve more than breakfast but I only come early in the morning. 

They offer everything you could want for your breakfast cravings (French toast, bagels, egg platters, breakfast burritos etc).

They also offer great options for lunch including a salad bar - which I've yet to try but I might soon. 

Service is quick and staff is friendly. 

This is my go to spot due to the convenience of the location but I know of other people who work in the financial district and go out of their way to stop by in the morning. 

I'll be back soon.
author: Ashley L.

description: Overpriced. The prices on the menu versus what they charge you are completely different. Food is good but completely unfair. Gone on three different occasions and always charged $2-$3 more then the menu price.
author: Alex B.

description: Fountain is definitely better for breakfast over lunch. Decently priced (for the financial district) and very consistent. I usually go for one of the bagel breakfast sandwiches, can't be mad at the breakfast burrito either.
author: Melissa H.

description: Arrived needed soft food while in post op recovery. Ordered a side of fries to go only with not that many folks ahead of me. My receipt is marked  12:26 and it's been more than 10 minutes...lame. the number ordered after mine has been called though.
author: Jacquelynn Y.

description:
This Place definitely deserves a good review. 

I come here often for my lunch, the sandwiches here are really good. They taste really fresh. I used to eat Tuna Melt Sandwich but now i moved to Chicken salad sandwich #3 on signature Sandwiches. 

They recently increased price, but previously i used to wonder how are they serving the food so cheap?

The sandwiches are definitely awesome, also the ladies at the counter are super nice.

Also they have a lot of seating space inside and out, so give it a try.
author: Urvish -.

description:
Worst sandwich by far!!  Don't know why I keep going back!!  Ordered a tuna fish sandwich on wheat toast and a side of fries.  The person at register kept asking if a wanted the tuna melt.  I think we tried 6 or 7 times before we got the order in.

Order comes up.  I check and sure enough, the bread isn't toasted.  I bring it back to counter and tell them I asked for the bread toasted.  They take my sandwich and cook it under the panini maker.  So the bread gets toasted on the outside and cooks the veggies on the inside.  The moisture from the cooked veggies is absorbed by the non toasted bread which doesn't hold up very well.  Plus the moisture in the container make the fries all soggy too.

Hope fountain goes out of business.  I won't be back.
author: David L.

description: I keep trying to eat breakfast here but the place is woefully understaffed. 25 minutes since I placed an order for a breakfast sandwich they have not started it.  This is the third time I've had this experience. I'm done
author: Thomas B.

description:
Very disappointed with this place. I expected the food to be larger portions.
Ordered a veggie omelette with a side of bacon for $13.95 and the food portion was small and not enough. 
If you're going out elsewhere, stay away for this place will get you smelling like grease.
author: Rommel Q.

description: This place charged my credit card twice on 3/9/18, when I showed the manager the double charge on my bank statement he refused to listen and credit me back or give me a lunch at no charge today (3/12/18), instead he wanted to argue with me, called the Police and told it was a civil matter, called my credit card company, they verified I was double charged and will credit me back after an investigation, I eat lunch here at least once a month, Never ever again will I eat here. Check your Credit Card Statements for double or more charges!
author: James D.

description: Came here with a co-worker who treated me to a turkey bacon sandwich. The lady behind the counter was very nice and the sandwich was absolutely great! I got the sandwich on Dutch crunch and it all just worked together so well. There was a lot of taste in the sandwich and I enjoyed every single bite. I will definitely come back to this spot again to eat at the location and even try some more stuff of the menu.
author: James R.

description: I've ordered breakfast sandwiches and deli sandwiches here; I can't comment on the salad bar. The service is always fast and friendly and the place looks and feel very clean. I got the #6 today and it's huge and delicious. I'd definitely recommend it for a less expensive lunch in the area.
author: Angie B.

description:
Fountain cafe is one of my go to lunch spots. It's located on the third floor of Crocker Galleria. I always get my food to go so I can sit out under the glass arced roof or the roof garden, which allows me to enjoy my lunch under the sun, rain, fog, etc. 

The guys that work here are sweet and always greet me upon arrival. Service is fast, yet personable. The guy who usually works at the hot food bar always remembers my order... Baked potato and mixed veggies, please and thank you! 

The menu is extensive. There is a hot food bar and a salad bar located at the back of the restaurant. You can also order breakfast, wraps, crepes, sandwiches and paninis at the front counter. They offer chips, sodas, and cookies as add ons. The quality is decent and the portions are generous. I need to express the value of this place. I get so stoked that I can get a yummy lunch for $5!!! 

I recommend this place for a fast, filling and inexpensive lunch in the downtown area.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Oh wait, this isn't Foundation Cafe? What was I thinking? I was sauntering over to the Galleria looking for a late lunch when I noticed this place on the third floor with all the other fair-to-middling eateries. All of them appeared to be closing up shop at a bit past 2PM. I give the staff here credit for not shooing me away hungry, disgruntled and actually getting a sandwich at Jimmy John's, owned by a right-wing conservative who enjoys killing animals on safari like a certain dentist we all revile.

Thankfully I did not have to compromise myself politically and was able to order here or so I thought. Perhaps I should have played it safe and got a $4.99 BLT or even a $5.99 Reuben off the grill. However, I was in the mood for a hot lunch and threw my dice on the table to order their $8.19 Hot Entree with Salad, Veggie and Bread. That day, it was a Grilled Pork Chop, but the grill was already shut off for cleaning. So they took a cooked Pork Chop out of the fridge and nuked it along with a serving of mixed zucchini, yellow squash and carrots.

The vegetables weren't terrible, but that pork chop was dry to the bone with a slathering of sauteed mushrooms and onions making no-never-mind of the plate. No bread or salad either, just some congealed brown rice they forgot to nuke with the chop (photo: http://bit.ly/1Iq8c2p). Does this look good to you? Then you would have enjoyed the commissary at San Quentin. At least you get Jell-o there unless I'm remembering the wrong Jimmy Cagney movie. They didn't have microwave ovens back then.

FOOD - 2 stars...I wish they would have just said they had no hot food instead of serving something my mom would have made on one of her off days
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...diner set-up in the Galleria, no big whoop
SERVICE - 2 stars...ditto my comment about the food
TOTAL - 2 stars...stick with the sammies, less risk there
author: Ed U.

description: Fountain Cafe deserves higher ratings that 3.5 stars! This place satisfies so many diverse cravings in a high quality, fast way and they have the best prices in all of FiDi. You can build your own salad, order from the hot bar, customize a sandwich or wrap, indulge in breakfast all day long...the options are endless. If I don't know what to eat for lunch I head here and walk out with an affordable and filling meal.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Here's what I like about this place: It opens early for breakfast (unusual in our laid-back west coast city). Basic diner food, for a decent price. you can get bacon, eggs, hash browns, and toast for about $6.00. Is it the best diner food? No. But if you're tired of paying $20 for a basic breakfast, you won't be disappointed. 

For lunch, they do have a salad bar, burger specials, and hot food specials every day. Again, think value, not excellence, and you'll be satisfied.
author: Jason P.

description: They serve breakfast food all day which is a plus! I like breakfast food and really like their French Toast with eggs and bacon or sausage. They have very good omelettes also.  For lunch I usually have their fish and chips. They have a good variety of lunch items to choice from, both hot and cold sandwiches. They have hot food and salad by the pound. Located at the Crocker Gallaria.
author: Elaine T.

description:
It's nothing spectacular but Fountain Cafe is one of the more reliable spots in Crocker for a quick grab and go kind of lunch be it the salad bar or items from the ala carte menu. 

In a rush, the by-the-pound salad bar is the fastest way in and out. My defaults are the salad wraps though. The grilled chicken Cesar salad wrap with a spinach tortilla is typically the first choice although I've had the chicken apple salad wrap fairly often too. Both are under $6. It's quick, cheap, and just the right amount of food for workday lunch. As a bonus, they take cards  which makes it faster and more convenient. Not everything's a hit though. Personally was unimpressed with the falafel sandwich which tasted stale. 

Reasonably friendly staff pushing out food as quickly as possible to get you out the door is a quick plus here. While not everything is an ace, the extensive menu covers quite a bit from all-day breakfast to burgers and fried chicken strips. You'll probably find something here and if you have time, take it up to the roof of Crocker Galleria and enjoy some sunshine while you're at it.
author: Jon L.

description: Feels like home made meals. So delicious and severs were friendly. I might go here frequently every week. It's on the 3rd floor and you can find this place easily.
author: Changmin L.

description:
i love getting cheap breakfast food here for lunch. i know, i know who orders a denver omelette for lunch? well, i do haha. they serve breakfast here all day. they also serve other foods like sandwiches, panini, pasta, and they have an open salad bar! so i ended up ordering a denver omelette that comes your choice of toast & hashbrown (or potatoes) and garlic fries for less than $10!! and you get your food pretty quick. i think they gave me a generous amount of garlic fries for $2.29. how amazing is that?! the food here is good, but not spectacular. i love their hashbrowns and garlic fries. i've ordered a breakfast quesadilla before and it was pretty good too. just don't expect high quality food for the price.

there's plenty of seating inside and outside (since it's located inside the crocker galleria). there's also two outdoor seating areas inside the crocker galleria. there's the rooftop garden and the rooftop terrace, they're located on the opposite sides of the galleria. just look for the signs!
author: Sylvia H.

description: This place has everything you could possibly want from sandwiches, both hot and cold, soup, salad bar, hot food section with choices such as chicken cordon blue, chicken parm, spaghetti and meatballs, and many others. They serve a variety of breakfast dishes all day. The atmosphere is clean and the employees are friendly.
author: Michelle V.

description:
Good variety of food but hygiene is an area of concern for me. 

I ordered a vegetarian wrap for lunch and the woman making my wrap was not wearing gloves (unlike other competing restaurants in the area). Also, without washing her hands, she made my wrap while also making what appeared to be a turkey and bacon sandwich. Using the same unwashed hands for both, she handled my vegetarian wrap and the meat-packed sandwich. Again, not customary for food-service locations.
author: Anna M.

description:
I'm usually skeptical about eating at the restaurants at Crocker Galleria. There are plenty of places to eat downtown and Crocker is usually home to generic/ overrated / chains (like 360 "Gourmet" Burrito) that just don't fit my fancy. My homegirl Rita I. raved about the Mushroom and Swiss Burger she had at Fountain, so we went in for lunch today to catch up with our former co-worker.

The place is very clean, but stiflingly warm! Put some fans in there, guys. It's not even that warm out today and I was starting to glisten in my cotton tee. Anywho, my friend ordered the Fish and Chips, which, upon eating, said it tasted like "nothing", hmm. Rita I. got the Tuna Melt with fries which looked good and she liked it, and I had the Reuben with fries.

Not a great sandwich, but it was edible I suppose. I picked it up and water / oil dripped all over my plate, and continued dripping until I put the sandwich on top of some napkins. It was a freakin' waterfall! I know that microwaved meat when I taste it, also you have to drain the water off the plate so the customer doesn't think about the prep mode. I used to work in restaurants, I know the tricks. I was literally gnawing at the meat. Maybe it was old, but it was near impossible to take a single bite without full pieces falling onto my plate. And all that pulling out of meat caused the soggy light rye bread to crumble in hand.

I'm all for the benefit of the doubt, and my fries and pickle were excellent, so I may go back to try a burger. I hate to think back on food I've spent money on and imagine what else I could have gotten with it. For $8.68 I could have had a  fresh bahn mi from Pho Express, plus chips and guac from Chipotle, 'nuff said.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Ventured into this cafe at the top floor of the Crocker Galleria. Free wifi and plenty of tables and chairs. Wasn't very packed during lunch hours but it was a full house. There's a salad bar in the back for $7.50/lb. Sandwiches and wraps are decent price $5-6.

Got myself a seafood wrap. For $5.29, you get yourself a 6 inch long wrap filled with imitated crab meat and veges. Nothing really special about this wrap that would cause me to order it again...
author: Benita M.

description:
If i could give half stars, this place would be 3.5 at the most.

Located on the third floor of Crocker Galleria, the hubs & I stumbled upon this place because of the fancy sign to be honest. But when we approached the place, we saw that they sold breakfast platters, as well as sandwiches, crepes, and salads.

It's pretty spacious with several tables inside and outside. There is a self-serve salad bar in the back that you pay up at front. 

A lot of their foods are sort've pricey. They range from $2- $7 usually. We stuck with a sandwich and a wrap.
- Chicken Apple Salad Wrap: ($5 ish) This was a fairly decent wrap. Has a good amount of chicken and green apple slices along with red onions, lettuce, and a creamy vinagrette type of sauce.
- Turkey Cranberry Sandwich: ($6 ish) you can customize this sandwich by choosing your bread, cheese, and whether you want to remove condiments or add some. We had it with wheat roll and American cheese. This was also a fairly good sandwich. Has a nice amount of cranberry sauce and turkey, and the bread wasnt too hard to bite into. 

While the food was good, the workers were kinda snooty. The woman behind the register was sneering a lot at the other customers. Not sure if she was having an off day, but yeah, not the greatest customer service. Wifi is available but slow.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
The price is very comfortable and the food is mediocre. It honestly made my stomach upset immediately after attempting to it. 

The problem with most restaurant is not acknowledging that food must be clean even when it is not fresh. 

It felt like they use the exact same grill to cook different things and probably the same oil to fry meals. I had a really bad experience eating food from this restaurant, don't go to this place unless you have a stomach of Steele. 

Very sweet staff tho!
author: Allan S.

description: I've only had the turkey burger here, but it's so good (and big!) I keep going back for it. Plus it's cheap - just $5!
author: Roger H.

description: David L. You looked familiar to me from yesterday. I was behind you yesterday. You were so rude to the lady register, man! You ordered for a sandwich that there's is not even listed on their menu. And take note! The lady weren't asking you for 6-7 times. She just wanted to make sure and asked you a several times not 6 or even 7 times. I was listening how rude you were! When it's my turned after you. I asked her why he ordered something that I can't see on menu a Tuna Fish Sandwich but as I can see, TUNA SALAD SANDWICH was in there. If you wanna make a complain. Make sure that there's no one's around you and hear your dialect! You brought your bad attitude to another restaurant again. Just go to the chinese restaurant instead. ok? You made a wrong decision to express out your words here when I was about to give a 5 stars in this place for the sweet and excellent services. And I so appreciated that. And you're right! You better to not to go back in this place and bring your bad attitude over and over again.
author: Chloe M.

description: Amazing food , good portions & cheap prices for it being DOWNTOWN!!!! Can't go wrong with this place . Lovely staff as well
author: Amber G.

description: I called Fountain Cafe to cater breakfast. Not only did they provide delicious, good-quality food, they set up chafing dishes, included condiments such as several hot sauces and catsup for the breakfast burritos. The French toast, eggs and bacon were nicely presented.  Everyone raved about the food asking where I catered it from.  Even the picky "foody" exec commented favorably.  All this at a price that post mates or any other delivery service would charge and throw the food at you and run.  I appreciate the care and friendly service they provided.  If you want great catering service go with Fountain Cafe.  They put in the extra effort to make your event special. I'll be ordering from them again.
author: Lynn L.

description: They have a couple of options here, salad bar, combination plates, and cafe menu items. I got a combination plate with one entree and two sides. I picked the chicken, vegetables, and rice. The chicken had a tasty bbq glaze but the inside was very dry. The mixed vegetables were barely cooked and very crunchy. The plate also came with a bread. The only pro was that the portion sizes were big.
author: James S.

description:
Let's count this down--makes it easier on both of us: 

10. Best breakfast burrito--you will instantly gain five pounds and you won't be able to eat for the rest of the day, but this hangover helper does the job. 

9. Fountain's salad bar is the chronic of all salad bars in the FiDi. They even have falafel! 

8. Clam chowder. It's not loaded with potatoes (i.e., filler). It's creamy. It's delicious. It's served on Fridays. It's $2.50. 

7. Bagels! There are all kinds of flavors. I recommend the jalapeño cheddar. Get it toasted. Get cream cheese on the side. Get $2.50 out of the bottom of your purse. Then get going. 

6. What in the hell is chicken coteletti? I don't know either, but one of these days I'm going to order it just for S&G. Fountain has it every day! 

5. All of their soups are yummy! Cream of asparagus, cream of cauliflower, cream of broccoli - oh yes, they are all yummy. 

4. They do serve beer, but why are you going to the Crocker Galleria to drink beer? 

3. Quick service--cause we're in a big hurry! Fountain has more than one person working the registers, and their menu is designed to move food out quickly. 

2. You can get a dessert crepe or baked salmon with brown rice or a BLT or enchiladas here. Now that's a diverse menu. 

~AND~ 

1. Yet another lunch spot under $10 in the FiDi. Hurrah!
author: Sunny S.

description:
The #6 - Turkey, Ham & Bacon Sandwich with Cheddar Cheese, Lettuce, Tomato, Mustard & Mayonnaise on Wheat Bread is delicious. I will have to try this sandwich on one of their rolls next time. Good food, good service, clean facility and friendly staff members.

Three team members takes orders and payments while other members take care making the food. I must admit the food does come out quick which is good so props for this part.

There is Free Wi-Fi available for customers' convenience. I like the fact that they have flat screen televisions installed with news and sports being broadcasted.
author: Bennett W.

description: Let me start by saying the food is decent and cheap. Although the service isn't the greatest. My last time going (today), they mixed up my burrito with the man behind me. I watched him unwrap my burrito with his bare hands and look inside, only to find it wasn't his burrito. To which case the server says, "Hurry, give it back to me" and thy go wrap a new piece of tinfoil on it like nothing happened..while I was watching the whole thing. Needless to say, I won't be back.
author: Evan V.

description:
My favorite go to lunch place when I worked by Maiden Lane. I was always able to get a good lunch for under $8 and the salad bar was my favorite. I always grabbed some of their cold pasta (with the spinach) and mixed it with some real salad so it would fill me up better. They have tons of toppings too so you can add all the things you love, just remember to not go too crazy. 

Like others have said the cashiers are pretty rude. All they do is talk to each other and look like they hate their lives, but whatevs. I only have to deal with them when I pay my food and that less than a minute worth of interaction. 

I definitely recommend coming here for lunch if you don't want to spend that much.
author: Renee Y.

description:
I must say that they face tough competition with restaurants next door, in Crocker Galleria and many restaurants on Kearny Street.

I bet Financial District workers who get off at lunch are extremely confused on where they should fill their stomach hunger!  This place is conveniently located in Crocker Galleria and targeted to financial district working class during lunch hours to grab cafe food!

Having sandwiches, a salad bar, breakfast and coffee selections, this cafe fits the standard of being a cafe!

Don't expect fine, fancy food here, but a good meal for lunch!

Wi-Fi is pretty slow - probably because there are so many other Wi-Fi and usage in this area!

They do have unbeatable butter bagels for $1.25!  Toasted and buttered to quick perfection!

Commendable service and orders are served pretty quickly!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Where does one get pancakes in the FiDi? Where can you get some good old fashioned pancakes with eggs and bacon? Turns out it is harder to find  than you can expect. 

The search brought us to Fountain Cafe which is on the 3rd floor of the Crocker Galleria. It is a small little "diner" with some indoor and outdoor seating. The employees seemed brusque which is fine, it was early in the morning. In addition to pancakes, they also serve crepes, sandwiches, burritos and omelets. The food was bleh, I thought that there was no such thing as bad bacon but I was proven wrong. The bacon was dry and chewy. The pancakes were ok but the rest were meh.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I've been coming here for years (I work right across the street) and I never thought to leave a review for any of the Crocker Galleria places until now. This one is long overdue and I hope I can make up for lost time.
The Fountain Café is really quite an excellent lunch place. They have their fairly large standard menu of typical sandwiches, salad, soup and grill foods including hamburgers and grilled cheese. Also there is a good salad bar and a specials bar. Overall the widest menu of any place I know about. I like quality & variety, so this place suits me. I usually get the #7 sandwich (chicken, bacon, avocado,) off the main menu and toast it at my office (but they will toast the bread for you if you want.) They put a lot of stuff on it (mustard, mayo, tomatoes, lettuce, pickles, onions) so be sure to tailor it to what you want. The sandwich is perfect and the bacon is truly excellent. $6.50 plus tax, one of the best deals anywhere downtown. But the real reason I'm writing today is because for the past two days I've had a particular specials bar offering. The specials rotate daily and has such things as Chicken or pork Collette, pork ribs, chicken Parmesan or Piccata, Lasagna or penne Bolognese, and many others. I think the full menu is about 25 items, with about 10 out on any given day. What I've had there the last 2 days is truly excellent and I have passed on it many times. I will probably never make that mistake again. It was the baked salmon. It was as good as any salmon I've ever had anywhere. I am talking as good as $35 salmon plates I've had at the finest restos in the city. The reason I've never ordered it before? You know that crappy salmon that is dry as a bone on the inside that you typically get at a café? I hate that with a passion. It is like eating slightly damp, warm  newspaper. But yesterday, it looked inviting, and I needed to eat something lower in calories, and with the 2 slices of lemon on top it looked great. So I took the chance. Best. Decision. Ever. The salmon was bowl-me-over good! Just perfectly moist inside, just a little crisp on the outside. The lemon provides a perfect tartness to it when you poke it a bit to release the juice. The salmon is simply prepared, just a hint of salt maybe. Now comes the best part: With your specials entrée you get a decent sized side (Caesar, spaghetti, mashed potatoes, or veggies [mostly squash]) AND bread for --- $9.05 including tax. You are out the door with a tremendous piece of salmon, salad and bread. Try to find that anywhere in S.F. I dare ya.
author: Jeff S.

description: We spent lots of time in San Francisco trying to find places to eat and struck out more often than not, until we found the Fountain café. Not only was the food great, the selection was great, and as far as San Francisco prices go, they are unbeatable. It doesn't matter if you want breakfast lunch or dinner, they have what you're looking for and the price is right. On top of all that, the entire staff was very personable and accommodating..
author: Brady W.

description:
Pretty expansive and decently priced food in the FIDI hidden in Crocker Galleria. Most sandwiches and wraps around $5-6. Sold.

I tried the salad buffet which is pretty whatever - I'd advise skipping it. They do have a lot of hot plate options which would be more appealing if I didn't care more about my diet (like meatloaf, mac n cheese, lasagna!). From other people's reviews it looks pretty good but I like coming here for the fairly cheap sandwich and the healthier falafel wrap (which is a pretty good size for $5.50!)
author: Emily C.

description: years of living in san francisco...having lived just up the street...first time visiting crocker galleria...never knew this existed...small and narrow shopping mall structure wedged between buildings...plenty of lunch options...fountain cafe upstairs...cafeteria style restaurant...menu above the wall and some specials for the day...breakfast, salad, sandwiches or full entrees...weekday lunch and taking a sandwich...bacon, avocado and cream cheese sandwich $5.75...a small soda $1.75...$7.65 total for a meal...fairly low pricing for a fidi lunch...tables plenty inside and more outside...hearty trays of pre-cooked meats and dishes for bigger meals available...decent meal, large portions and cheap prices...
author: Hen A.

description: This was my first time ever eating here, and I am very disappointed :( I came in at around 1:15 and ordered the Nutella dessert crepe to go. They took 20 minutes to make the crepe (it wasn't busy at all) and, when I finally got back to work to eat, there was barely any Nutella in it. Surely you can't call a crepe a "Nutella crepe" if you don't put an ample amount of Nutella in it, right?
author: Mihaela P.

description: Can't even give this place a review because it wasn't open when it said it would be. Tv was on lights were on doors locked. Even the neon signs they have out were on. Tried to call before that and no answer
author: Donna R.

description:
I get the grilled ham and cheese here. Comfort food for me at lunch. I feel like I'm 13 again, at diner with my folks after a Sunday night church service.

It's located in the Crocker Galleria and has pretty diverse menu (of sandwhiches and breakfast items)

Salad bar is nifty as well...but too much effort for my lunch time.
author: Carina M.

description: Fantastic food and great service. I call in my order and they have it ready by the time I get there, it's incredible! And I call from the Montgomery station lol literally around the corner. Love this place so much!
author: Jason E.

description:
If you need that quick bite, this is your place to go.

This is solely based on their Italian chicken panini but I hope to amend my review soon based on their breakfast burritos. 

I was a little confused by the Italian chicken panini because it had a sweet apple smear on it with chicken. I don't think they confused my order because panini had chicken and is the only chicken panini on their menu.

The sweet Apple smear threw me off because that's not what I think of with "Italian".

I still hope to try their breakfast burrito because it's one of the only places I've found in FIDI that serves breakfast all day.
author: Jonathan T.

description: Worst customer service. My 1st 1 star rating in Yelp. It's the 24th of December, 7:30am, and the guy at the counter was cranky, unhelpful and discourteous. Won't be back.
author: Reena C.

description:
The people who work here are RUDE. 
I have been here a few times. My boyfriend loves their salad bar. I think it's just an average salad bar, but whatever, he's entitled to his opinion. 
I ordered a turkey, avocado wrap. It was just over $5, and really tiny. That is to be expected in the FiDi, so I let the size of the wrap go. 
What I couldn't let go of was the fact that there was aluminum foil inside my wrap from when they cut it in half. I would have picked the foil out and let it slide, but the fact that they are sooooo rude and thankless when you purchase food from them, I decided to take it back. 

***WTF, I am paying you MONEY. Be nice to me. Duh.  It's good for business when you are good to your customers. But they just literally do not give a rats a$% because they think you are expendable. 

Anyway, I asked for my money back and the guy manager made excuses, was pissed, wouldn't look at me, handed me the money like a total jerk, and didn't apologize. Wow. That's some pretty abrasive behavior. 

I am never coming back there, and will steer anyone who suggests it away and let them know how they treat customers. 

You people need to learn some customer service skills. You suck. Bye.
author: Alanna R.

description:
People at work love this place and we even get breakfast from here time to time (you can't really screw up breakfast).

BUT...I am currently regretting my decision to leave the Soup Co line because my impatience has led me to choose Fountain Cafe's meatball sandwich. Completely starving, I voraciously ate about have of it before realizing that the reddish hue that left me unphased in my state of reckless abandon was in fact...uncooked meat. How do you mess up meatballs!?!??!

As I write this, I am trying to coat my stomach by forcing down as much of the unappetizing soggy caesar salad (premade and just a floppy mess) as possible, all in hopes that it will create a swift and problem-free delivery system throughout my GI tract. Congrats on forcing me to choose the lesser of two evils, Fountain Cafe.
author: Nick W.

description:
Seems to be A-ok.

Tried the plate lunch today, for $8.38, you get two phat tamales, a generous serving of spanish rice and a side casaer salad.
The Tamales had nice sized chunks of pork, that was tastey and cooked with flavor. Smooth corn maize was missing the characteristic nuggets of ground corn, but none the less, was tastey. The rice was good too;  and you get a generous amount of fresh green salad. Muy Sabor. Good quality is never cheap. The salad bar looked good too; I finished the meal with apple juice.

They have a selection of fruit drinks, including Aranchiatta, Limoncetta and Apple Juice. 

I'll return.

Customer service: ok and speedy.

Decor: ok.

p.s. they told me they make their daily specials from scratch. Those tamales were dang good!
author: Bert K.

description:
I came here once in search of a fancy coffee drink, owing to the fact that "cafe" is in its title.

Well, no fancy coffee. They do have a selection of the straight black stuff near the front. This is all a little bit surprising, because they have a huge selection of pretty much everything else. My black coffee and a massive omelet, potatoes, and four slices of toast clocked in at about $10. Tasty food at a ridiculous price for the FiDi. 

And, as an avid breakfast eater, I can tell you the options are pretty slim in the neighborhood. There's a La Boulange up on Sutter, and Boudin down on Market. (Which now serves scrambled eggs in a bread bowl, wtf?!) Fountain Cafe is a pretty rare find. It also has free WiFi, which I found plenty speedy the one time I used it.

A note about the service -- yeah, they're "gruff," if that word means "a person who takes your money and gets your food done promptly without a lot of small talk."
author: David S.

description: Ordered white wine chicken w/ veggies and caesar salad.  Chicken was lukewarm at best, salad soggy, veggies bland. My friend ordered rotisserie chicken, which they proceeded to microwave to warm up prior to serving....uh yeah. I'll pass, wouldnt recommend.  Too many lunch spots to pay $10.99 for bad food.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This has always been my standby comfort food place. It's like an old school diner in the Financial District. 
They closed for a few months to update the place. I must say I am impressed, I walked in an the cashier had to wake me out of a stupor, to take my order, I was looking at all the changes, making sure it was still the same place. Well Done Fountain Cafe, Well Done.
I would have taken pictures, but I forgot my phone.
author: Monica H.

description: I love fountain cafe. I love how the staff remembers my order, and how friendly they are. I used to come here every morning for my egg white omelete with sausage and cheese. When it's later in the day, I come in for a cheese burger and no vegetables.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Parfait review only!

$1.99 for a fruit/yogurt/ parfait topped with granola. I personally don't enjoy my parfaits being overwhelmed with granola, and the parfaits here had as much granola as there was yogurt, so boo to that =(. I asked the owner if he could make mine with less granola, and he simply told me to just dump off some granola. ?? I asked cause I wanted more yogurt , but oh well, beggars can't be choosers, and for $1.99 it's a pretty good deal in the FIDI. Maybe I'll come around to try the food next time I'm in this plaza.
author: Angela K.

description:
Had lunch here now for several years, and always blown away by the home cook food and awesome salad bar.  Just a great atmosphere and a fair price to be paid.
Always take clients and friends to this food oasis, that produces healthy, hearty food and a good price.
author: Karl M.

description:
This place has a huuuge menu.  Fresh salad, above average sandwiches, and damn decent entree's all for affordable prices.  It's tough to break the $10 mark for lunch.  NO TIP NECESSARY!!  cha ching

Ask for a frequent customer card, I ate here for weeks before I realized they had one - sneaky bastards wont say a thing.

The only thing to NOT order - turkey burger.  BLEH
author: Farrell W.

description:
Nice salad bar, many selections.  Middle Eastern choices such as pita, hummus and falafel.  Clean looking.  

Falafel was really, very dry and the service could use some friendliness, but overall, it is a nice place.  About $7.50 a lbs for salad.
author: Abigail J. M. M.

description:
Pretty good food.
1 star deducted for 2 reasons :
The woman on th cash register is not pleasant at all.
When they give food to-go , the box they use is cardboard.The food gets really soggy.
Their pancake syrup is weird.
Otherwise, whatever I have eaten here has been consistently good.
author: P D.

description: I didn't get a chance to even eat my food when the man working there shuts the lights off on me! Didn't say anything. Just shut them off. Poor service. Got my food to go and I don't even want it now.
author: Alyssa M.

description: The best lunch deal in Crocker Galleria.  I ear from their salad bar so I can't comment on the hot food.  The salad bar is always fresh, with a nice selection of meats, veggies, and condiments.  The grilled chicken is always tasty.  I also love their tabouli as well. Friendly staff.  I've been going there for years.  I would go more often if they restated the salad bar selection from time to time.
author: Martin B.

description:
So impressed that I had to write something!

Checking out their menu as a vegan, I noticed a few things I could do, but what's this Mediterranean Veggie Wrap? Is that olives & feta? Is it eggplant & squash? I figured I'd just call.

Turns out it's falafel & veggies with a tahini sauce! A while ago, one shop owner told me that his falafels had egg in them & even though I'm sure 99.9% do not, I asked the man on the line if this was egg & dairy free. He caught on that I was pussy-footin' around the word "vegan" and told me he thought so, but wasn't positive. He took down my name & number, called the supplier & called me back to confirm that they are, in fact, vegan! Booyah! 

Peter was super nice & super helpful & never passive towards me. Instead of brushing me off, he found out & followed up. Can't tell you how much I appreciate that! He didn't have to go through any trouble, but he did & with zero fuss.

Thank you Peter! The wrap was so good that my coworker ordered one after she saw mine!
author: Mel S.

description: At the farmers market and decides to come in cause of the stars in Yelp. Tried a hot plate, you Microwaved my food! I don't even own a microwave. C'mon party people this isn't the suburbs.
author: Sarah T.

description:
This place has an AMAZING salad bar filled with tons of veggies and a variety of different kinds of pasta and other salads. 

They also have a great grill and will make you almost anything you want. I ordered a grilled cheese and asked them to add tomato, no problem. It was delicious. 

Defiantly my new favorite lunch spot!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I have come to Fountain Cafe for breakfast during the lunch hour a number of times.  I confess that I fairly regularly get a craving for French Toast or Pancakes for lunch.  Of course, most of the restaurants that open primarily to serve the lunch crowds either in SOMA or the Financial District not surprisingly tend to center their menus around sandwiches, salads & soups.  Fountain Cafe is one place that I have found to satisfy my breakfast cravings.

Fountain Cafe is pretty much just an OK place, certainly nothing spectacular.  Prices are reasonable, but it can get quite busy around the lunch hour rush, so you should expect a bit of a wait as well.

Fountain Cafe is located on the upper level of the Crockett Galleria.  There are also a number of other restaurants on this level.  It is also only one easy flight of stairs up to the outdoor rooftop garden area atop the Crocker Galleria.
author: Joel E.

description:
$4 OFF TODAY ANYWHERE IN THE CROCKER GALLERIA. Feb 29th Only.

AFTER the discount, I paid $4.25 for a pretty decently-sized salad. The salad bar has a good fruit selection, a variety of pasta salads, and a bunch of fixing for a Greek salad (tabouli, hummus, pita bread, etc). 

That said, I probably won't return without another discount...there are a lot of sandwich/salad places in the Financial District.
author: Talia G.

description:
I was definitely happy about the price, but just recieved horrible service. Tried to do an "online" order- I prepaid, and ordered a half hour ahead. They ignored me when I got there, I waited until the others in line were served. They tell me-oh, it's not ready. 
People who ordered after me continued to be served, and leave. This manager looking type guy behind the counter who ignored me consistantly then rushed to help a MAN coming to the line but never said a word to me. I finally noticed a sandwich sitting on the back counter, and asked the register people "is that my sandwich?" It was. Really, how hard can it be, people? You really made me feel like shit, and I was polite and patient the whole time.
author: Mom P.

description:
Good sandwiches, the tuna melt is my favorite. Kick ass breakfast burritos too. The manager there seems like he remembers everyone's name and says hello all the time. 

They have a stamp card, if you spend $6 8 times you get a free $6 :D

A lot of people get the salads but I'm just not into them, get a salad around the corner from Harrow, those are seriously good salads.
author: Kortni S.

description: Hot breakfast platter early M-F. Stack of pancakes is ginormous so you may want to order the short stack and sides instead. There is oatmeal and bacon and eggs and great coffee too in a spacious, well lit clean location in Crocker Square mall 3rd floor Financial District.
author: D J.

description: the food is good but the employees here couldn't be ruder or more entitled. Someone should inform them they are in the service industry
author: Sarah A.

description: I came here for lunch today and I'm disappointed I spent $8.00 on a patty melt and fries, the melt has no taste, the fries are fries, the music here is god awful, I'm just not feeling Dub Step or David Gueta at lunch time. The two people at the register are clearly working on different pages, they have things on their menu that they don't have in stock (fish and chips). This place has potential but the food isn't good and it seems unorganized and this shouldn't be too hard it's just lunch
author: Travis B.

description: Got a panini grilled turkey sandwich here yesterday and was very happy with it! Tasted great and the service was fantastic. Not to mention it was just under $7.00! Definitely coming back here again1
author: Jessie F.

description: Great breakfast deal for FiDi. I usually get the pancake special or an omelet. Also good deal for burgers & fries. Salad bar has a good selection too but it bothers me that they don't post the per pound price. It's probably the only place in this immed area that doesn't have the salad bar price psoted that I can think of. What are they trying to hide? Anyway, it's $8.99/lb as of TODAY. Most of the time the staff is pretty friendly. My good timing I guess....
author: Luisa k.

description: I come here almost everyday. Hot food is the best! The menu changes everyday. Fresh from the grill items are good! Sometimes it satisfies my taste buds better than other days. Salad bar fair $7 something per Lb. PER POUND   Don't be surprise if you end up with a $20 salad.. Service? The cashiers are NICE. Sometimes people are too busy on their phones or talking with their colleagues. It seems people now days want their behind kissed and wiped..... Prices are fair for the FIDI area. There is a .10 cent fee for bags. This is the LAW not the business or the cashiers fault.How ever I'm giving this place 4 stars because they need a espresso machine.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Note: This is the Fountain Cafe in the Crocker Galleria and not the one near the foot of Sutter.

Fountain Cafe has been my favorite FiDi salad bar for years. They always have such fresh and interesting choices.

I usually build my salad with a bed of dark greens topped with babaganouj and tabbouleh and a few dolmas. Amazingly, I think they make their dolmas there because they definitely do NOT taste or feel like canned. Their hummus is okay, but the babaganouj is miles better.

Some of my other favorites there are the curry chicken salad with shell pasta, raisins and chunks of apple and celery. When they have it, I load up on the "lite" turkey salad made in the style of chicken salad. They sometimes have falafels, but I usually pass on those as they tend to be on the dry side. I also wish they would change their brand of pita, but I give them points for usually having plain AND whole wheat on hand.

Among their vegetable options they have plain artichoke hearts, which I love because the delicate artichoke flavor is not overpowered by vinaigrette.

Their hot food selections are enormously popular but I have to admit that I have never tried any of them. As soon as I walk through the door the salad bar calls out to me and I can't choose anything else!
author: Valeria R.

description:
Meh.

Been working in the FiDi for almost three months now and I haven't had the time really to explore around. That, and I hate looking like an idiot tourist in my own hometown so I've been mainly sticking to the Crocker Galleria (awesome for its wifi and ample seating choices).

I've been to Fountain twice. Once to buy a Red Bull and now to satisfy the hot pastrami sandwich i've had for the past few weeks. Both times the lady at the counter was stand off ish and annoying. She also looks like she hates her life. The place however, is nicely lit  with lots of seating. I'll probably be back to try it again a few times before I really make up my mind about this place.

Brownie points for being one of the few places you can eat in the Financial District for less than 10 dollars (hate spending my money on food when it can go to more valuable use like the Michael Kors bag I've been eyeing!)
author: Kay M.

description:
An excellent salad bar and terrific daily specials make the Fountain Cafe located on the top level of the Crocker Galleria a very good place for lunch.

Coincidentally I had the Pollo Cacciatori just like David D. on Tuesday afternoon.  A tender extended chicken leg piece with soft green and yellow bell peppers, slivered onions and meaty tomatoes served over a bed of rice with a creamy, crunchy, cheesy Caesar Salad and a soft torpedo roll on the side.

Fountain Cafe has four hot entree specials each day in addition to a large menu featuring lots of regular breakfast and lunch selections.  There is plenty of seating inside of the restaurant in addition to the vast number of tables and chairs along the outer railings of the center and in the Roof Garden.

The service is fast and friendly and the food is inexpensive and filling.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
I really like going to this place for my salad bar and soup combo - so they don't have that many choices for soup but they consistently change their offerings and I always find a soup to my liking - $3 for soup beats Soup company that charges $6 for same size and I cannto say that they taste 2x better!  Once in a while I'll get something from the hot foods station - meats are always cooked well, pasta's not their greatest strength - sandiches are full and pretty tasty... breakfast is good too - they are ok with your customization and rarely mess my order up (I am s bit picky as I have a few food allergies, and like to change things around a bit :) )
Overall I'd give them 4.5 but since I cannot, they get a 5.  VERY AFFORDABLE and ask for the discount card - if you buy 8 lunches over $6 you get $6 worth of food for free - my salad/soup combo is usually around $7...
author: Zayka Z.

description:
I previously bought one of their lunch entree specials (chicken parmigiana) but today I ordered a cheesesteak w/ fries.  This set me back almost close to $10.

Sandwich came out fast but as w/ the problem with Camille's Sidewalk Cafe, you get a big bun w/o very little filling inside.  There's a bit of beef, bits of onion and pepper here and there but not much.  For this price, I expected more!

Fries were good.  Not overcooked.

This place is ok but again, too pricey for me!
author: Wendy H.

description:
It's bone chilling cold today in SF, so there's no way I was going to eat my lunch outdoors.   Most of the time, actually, I'll grab something to go and eat it at my desk, but I really needed to take a mental break, it being Friday and all.   So I made my way to the Crocker Galleria.

I walked past Chili's, where I ate as recently as last week.   I refuse to eat at Gourmet 360 burrito since there are so many places that make a better one.   While I greatly enjoy Chaat Cafe, I already ate Chicken Tikka Masala there on Tuesday, so I wanted something different.   Fountain Cafe, I thought, may well carry a nice juicy burger.

Indeed they do!  I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger with fries, a large drink, paid my $9 plus change, grabbed a table, and waited for my number to be called.   At 12:15 PM, the place was certainly packed and it was a challenge to make my way to the soda machine.   They eventually called out number 95 and I grabbed a plate on which was laid out a large burger with very generous amount of beef (1/3 of a pound, at least), onions, and tomatoes.  They were a bit stingy on the cheddar, but that's probably simply because I adore cheese and would, if I could, have a quarter pound of cheese on my burger.  :)

The burger:  quite tasty... certainly better than Downtown Flames on 2nd Avenue.   I haven't been to Bistro Burger in a while, but I think Bistro's still got an edge on them.    Still, the nice thing with Fountain Cafe is its proximity to my work and the fact that they serve many many things besides just burgers.    I'll be back for sure.
author: David O.

description: I came here originally to try the sandwiches (#8) which were pretty good. There are probably better sandwiches and better value out there, but it was definitely solid. What makes the place stand out, however, is the fantastic salad bar at $6.39/pound (a guy at our office comes for the salad bar every day for lunch). There is a wide variety of salad items, with the grilled chicken being my favorite. Unfortunately though, there wasn't grilled chicken when I went today. All in all a good find, and I will definitely be back for the salad bar in the future.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Quick, healthy, appetizing, and economical!  

Key items: sprouts, tofu, tuna, hardboiled eggs, grilled chicken, a variety of nuts, and fresh strawberries.
author: Cynthia C.

description: On the third floor of the Crocker galleria. (It was hard to find, but definitely worth it.) I went here on a business trip, and then I took a friend. Nice service and good food.
author: David H.

description:
Overall I found this place great even though it's been quite sometime.

I went in and thought having a breakfast burrito sounded great,so I went with that choice. They had a television I noticed and the place was clean.
There were a few customers enjoying something early like me.

So I decided to eat in and my order came out quickly and was filled with 
juicy ingredients. I was happy with the outcome,price and service overall.

This place might be worth a try during lunch,however I always welcome anything on regards to breakfast.

Anyways, this place is worth a try.

As I recall this place is on the 3rd floor I think.

I think....so look around.
author: Dani D.

description:
I used to lurk at this place a lot when I worked in the FiDi at a (gasp) full time job. This was because it is well located in Crocker Galleria and has a huge, diverse salad bar.

Now that I'm a nomadic worker who needs to pay a smidge more attention to basic infrastructure issues, I've come to appreciate this place even more: (1) there is free wifi and power outlets (well, a few shhhhh) all in Crocker; and (2) you can get some hearty *breakfast* at a REALLY cheap price. I got me some eggs, sausage, toast and coffee for about $6 the other day! 

Plus the staff is SUPER uber meta friendly: nailed my customized order, handled the crazy busy morning line with poise and effectiveness, and all with a smile. 

So, while Fountain is not Michelin level, it serves us po' folk just fine!
author: Diane B.

description:
The sandwiches are pretty tasty, but Lee's a block away is cheaper, faster, and about the same quality (although lacking in seating). 

The salad bar has lots of variety, but I'm totally not ok with paying $12 for a big box of lettuce. I go to the Galeria for the farmer's market on Thursday, buy a week's worth of salad fixings, and make a salad at my desk. MUCH cheaper.

My co-worker is hooked on their egg-mc-fountain sandwich, it's one of the few breakfast places in the FiDi that actually fries the egg up fresh instead of nuking a pre-made sandwich. Fountain is my favorite lunch spot at the Crocker Galeria, but it's nothing special.
author: Aaron M.

description:
You can get breakfast burritos with lots of veggies but watch out, the salsa makes it kinda soggy and messy if you don't eat it immediately.
They have a pretty decent salad bar at lunch.
It's a fast/convenient place to grab a bit, but nothing too extraordinarily amazing.
author: Ariana L.

description: Just found a bug the size of my fingernail clinging to a piece of lettuce from the salad bar.  Makes me think that they don't wash the lettuce -- what else don't they wash before serving it?  GROSS - goodbye fountain cafe.  there are better places to go in the Crocker.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
I had an italian chicken panini here.  While chicken, bread, and cheese were good, balsamic vinegar ruined the sandwich.  It did not go well with the rest of the sandwich.  If it's gonna be "italian" they should put tomatoes instead of balsamic vinegar.  Yuck.

Their ruben sandwich was fine though.   The cafe is too warm and stuffy inside, but the outside seating in the galleria was enjoyable.
author: Jessica N.

description: This place is great! I've gotten both breakfast and lunch here and had great food both times. Breakfast is really good, I've tried their bagel sandwiches and omelets and they were both great. Their salad bar is pretty extensive and I've liked the sandwiches I've gotten there for lunch.
author: Kristina B.

description: Don't you just love when the cashier messes up your order so when you let them know they proceed to talk about you right in front of your face with the other cashiers because they think you can't understand them even though you know exactly what they're saying? Yeah, me neither. There are plenty of places around here for a decent coffee and bagel with much nicer service. No thanks
author: E M.

description:
Awesome place for breakfast...we all know we need a good hearty breakfast now and again...usually Friday...

This place has a great breakfast, where eggs, toast , potatoes and bacon will cost you just over $5...that is a find in the city...and especially in FIDI, where your next best breakfast solution is Neetos or Sellers. Both of those places are good, but cost twice as much (almost)!!!

I added a pic, so you can get tempted today!
author: Jason S.

description: Great choices for lunch. I love the salmon sandwich, the omelets, or the half chicken dinner. Cant go wrong eating here. Friendly staff, great facilities, and you can watch a game late in the afternoon while sipping a beer.
author: Thomas B.

description: AWESOME breakfast sandwiches and BLTs! They also have a great salad bar. One of the most reasonably priced places in the financial district. I highly recommend it!
author: Monica G.

description:
Pros: The salad bar has a large selection of fresh fruits and veggies. Items off the menu are standard diner fare. They have a large chip and drink section too. 

Cons: Falafels are dry. The soups tend to be on the saltier side.

Also, their daily dish  is pretty tempting...just avoid the Caesar salad - it's soaked in the dressing.
author: Lisa R.

description:
I'm back working nearby, so I've had a chance to come back to Fountain Cafe numerous times in the past several months since 2006.  It's really the only restaurant in the Galleria that's satisfying enough to go back to on a regular basis.

The prices are cheap and their salad bar is great for a light meal--I always end up getting the same two types of pasta salads and fix up a small salad for myself.  And if I don't feel like splurging at Bistro Burger, their veggie burger and fries are a steal.  

Even with the stress of dealing with hoards of customers during the lunch rush, the cashiers always seem to put on a happy face.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Why so skimp? 

I mean their b-fast burritos was a mean son of a gun of a breakfast, a two hand kind of meal...but I guess with the times.. it has changed..

Their b-fast burrito is now sadly a thumb and two finger kinda meal =(

They started to use less eggs, sometime skipping out the potatoes, and pretty much all the ingredients are just SKIMP.

Now I go across the street for my b-fast burrito hungry girl fix.  Its the place that sells smoothies, and has a fruit stand in the front.   ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/wi-san-francisco) Its cheaper, and tastier! And they dont charge extra if you want veggie + meat!

Don't get me wrong, this place has TONS of stuff on their menu, but everything so seems kinda meh..

I use to come here for b-fast, AND lunch... but now... I ONLY come here when I get them awesome Crocker Galleria Coupons for $2 off my meal.

p.s. I do like their soup here! I think its taste better and cheaper then SF Soup Company!
author: Deanna T.

description: The boyfriend and I have come here a few time for our lunch dates (yay for working near each other!) and we've both enjoyed it.  I like that they have a variety of choices for the salad bar, and the sandwiches we've had here have been tasty as well.  It's not the best food we've ever had, but it's pretty darn solid too.  I can't complain, and he enjoyed watching the baseball games during lunch on the tvs too, so that definitely helped!
author: Quynh-An P.

description:
Very affordable for the Financial District!  A wide variety of options for breakfast and lunch.  Their salad bar is awesome!

My breakfast favorite: Bagel w/ cream cheese and vegetables (brussel sprouts, cucumbers, and tomatoes) for just $2.75 (tax included).  Doesn't get much better than that....

They have online ordering and if you call by phone they're nice w/ accommodating specific requests (well toasted bun, add jalapenos/pickles, etc.).  The staff is very friendly as well.
author: Aalok P.

description: The food is ok, and the stuff is not very friendly. I've been here a few times because I work in the area and I've yet to be greeted in a friendly manner.
author: Fabian M.

description: Mmmm, Fountain... Like everyone's favorite geyser, this deli/cafe in the Galleria is as dependable as they get. The food is good and the staff is very friendly. I recommend the french toast for breakfast or the turkey-cran sandwich for lunch. Their salad bar is pretty sizable if you're into that kind of thing (I'm a sandwich guy). Overall, I am a big fan of Fountain and will continue to drop by when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Peter C.

description:
It was not bad, but the food could be warmer.  We had the Chicken Parmesan and pasta special.  The person is warming/reheating the food for 45 seconds in the microwave, which is not enough time.

I see that there are other complaints about this here.

Prices were good, probably going to try it again, but get something else.
author: P B.

description:
This place is a home away from home.  I go in the mornings and every-time I am greeted with a nice 'hello' and a welcoming smile/greeting from the owner/manager.

The breakfast food is great:  Breakfast sandwiches are huge and have plenty of options for meat (sausage, turkey sausage, bacon, etc).  Breakfast burritos are soooo good.  And everyone works fast and efficient, they are very accommodating.  I highly recommend this place for breakfast on the go in the FiDi.
author: Joshua T.

description:
Healthy-food eaters, frugalistas, and vegans, take note. There are some great options here.

My favorite of late has been the avocado sandwich on wheat bread with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, sprouts, and mustard for $3.99. In my book that is a great deal. I've added the vegetable soup of the day, which is vegan, for $3.00. 

As others have said, there are many options here. I'm thrilled to see a sandwich place that has reasonable prices, very fresh ingredients, and multiple vegetarian options.
author: Christian B.

description:
I work across the street from the Galleria so this is so convenient! I'm a regular at Fountain Cafe, I usually get either a make your own sandwich or do the salad bar. I like this place because everything is really fresh and there is a lot to choose from in the salad bar. You just load up whatever you want, salad, fruit or one or more of the assortment of pasta salads and they weigh it and that's how the price is determined. I love this because I usually can't eat a whole portion of our meal sizes these days so I only take what I can eat. 

Overall I would say their prices are the lowest i've found for good quality in the financial district so that is a huge plus! Service is pretty consistent and fast and you can usually find a table if you want to eat there
author: Danielle G.

description:
Are you people crazy?
I had one of the lousiest lunches I've had outside of the Midwest there.
It was Chicken Parmigiana with pasta and Caesar Salad and a roll.
It was cold. The cheese was barely melted. The sauce had to have been from a can.
The lettuce seemed a little old and I don't know what they used for "Caesar" dressing -  took one bite and said forget it. The roll had a cloyingly sweet after taste.
The place looks like a greasy spoon so I didn't expect too much, but come on - they don't even try!
While I was sitting there another guy sent his plate back.
I only ate my lunch because I was starving and almost out of lunch time.
How does this place stay in business?
author: Chris B.

description:
Quite a salad bar they have.
Open kitchen for cooking fresh burgers. It smelled really good and I was hungry.

Hot dishes that need to be microwaved (which I don't really get, but at least food isn't actively overcooking), but it's a large selection with specials everyday. I saw meatloaf, fish (they can run out), white rice, brown rice, pasta, chicken, veggies, mashed potatoes, gravy (YAY!) and more. 

This was my first visit and I found the salad bar impressive (they had pasta salad in addition to the greens), but the hot dishes looked so good. I didn't know how the place worked so got the tortellini and a side of veggies. They gave me half a box of each and a flat fee of around 8 bucks, no weighing. Not what I was expecting and a LOT of food! 

The tortellini in tomato cream sauce with chicken was tasty and filling, as were the veggies. If you're getting takeout, I recommend sharing or planning on the same meal for two lunches. I'll definitely come back to try other dishes there.
author: Amy N.

description:
Everything looks like it would be tasty but I get one thing only:

SALAD BAR

At a price of $6.39/lb it really is a great deal. It surprasses the one at Whole Foods.  And certainly Mixt Greens.

You will be very happy you went for lunch.  Check it out.
author: Scott P.

description:
Make sure your committee meetings let out in time for lunch.  

I happened to hit the Crocker Galleria just as the noon bells were ringing.  I had time to circle the entire food court and settle on Fountain Cafe, a cozy little full-spectrum cafeteria.  

I got fresh chicken cacciatore right out of the oven.  Mixed vegetables that were firm.  Brown rice with texture.  All that, with a dinner roll and a diet Coke, for $8.72.  There were still tables open when I turned away from the cash register.  

Then, I watched from my seat as the park quickly turned into a zoo.  The Rooftop Garden benches were still damp from the morning drizzle, and everyone wanted to sit inside.  Soon the sea of customers was so thick I could hardly see the serving line.  But my meal was exquisite!  

Balancing the good impression of the delicious food and the stoneware platter was the stamped sheetmetal flatware, the paper napkins and cups, and the plastic tray.  But hey, it's a food court cafeteria!  

The lady with whom I was dining acted surprised that I left a tip for the busser.  I shared my belief that if more people tipped the bussers, the bussers would move a little faster.  

And at lunch, timing is everything.
author: David D.

description: Fabulous salad bar, and the best croutons ever!  My son enjoyed the French Toast for lunch, and said it was excellent as well.
author: Nancy C.

description:
I have just found my new lunch place.  Which conveniently doubles as my new place to buy egg and cheese breakfast sandwiches on bad mornings.  Yay! 

Prices are weirdly low, particularly for the financial district.  I had grilled cheese with avocado today, and they were the opposite of skimpy on the avo.   Tomorrow maybe a tuna melt? So excited.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Need to feed a hungry family of 16 for a mere $8.24? Sweet, here's your spot!

I had heard about this place from a trumpet player I met and he swore by the fantastic roasted chicken lunch deal you can get here and he wasn't lyin. For under $10 you get a huge serving of half a roasted chicken, a fork lifter full of brown rice and a few tons of grilled veggies. Okay, maybe not that much, but this meal was HAAAYUUUUGE and so filling and yummy. The perfect lunch for a chilly SF day. 

Will I be back? Does a cray cat lady need a lint brush? Shiiiiiit.
author: Stephy S.

description:
Nice!  Didn't realize this was here.  I had this apple pork chop with veggies and mashed potatoes, all for under $9!  Out of all my lunch companions, I think I had the best meal =)

I'd definitely come back - their specials seem pretty good.
author: Liz L.

description:
Places like this scare me....like Lee's or Julies Kitchen, I never know where to stand....or what to do, or who to order from, and if i choose to get anything from the salad bar, i always end up with a container that weighs 10 lbs, and costs me $20.45.  So today I opted for a sandwich, so as to know what i would be paying when i got to the cashier.  No surprises.  The chicken salad sandwich was great, and i would probably come back here to try another cold sandwich, or something from their hot menu that looked pretty great as well.  

Get it to go and dine on the rooftop.
author: Lauren F.

description: Kia B. treated me to a free lunch! I know there's no such thing, but I'm basking in the glory for now. Fountain Cafe has a nice salad bar and a good selection of sandwiches. Today I enjoyed a trip to the salad bar and a BLT w/ avocado. I left the place for under $10. Put it in the lunch rotation.
author: Corey V.

description:
Super convenient for those in the FiDi. 
Casual, good variety of foods, and easy on the wallet. 
Service is always prompt and friendly.

And - you can now order online to pick up!

I also like the Crocker Galleria Frequent Dining Card. Have your card stamped each time you make a purchase of $6+. When you have 8 stamps, redeem your card and receive free meal (up to $6, or $6 off your meal).
author: Desiree L.

description:
Screw the salad bar everyone on here is raving about, go here for the chicken fingers! Where else in the Financial District do you find chicken fingers, fries and ranch dressing. 

Yu-hum!

CHICKEN FINGERS OR BUST!
author: Derek B.

description:
The salad bar is pretty good in terms of the selection and refill rate. The sneeze guard configuration is kind of awkward. I can't reach far enough in to retrieve my salad item without coming too close to the plexi. Not so close that I have to kiss it, but still too close for comfort. There are a usually a few facial grease imprints from those who couldn't reach yet insisted on doing so. Disturbing.

I tried their tuna casserole today. Tasted like Betty Crocker's Tuna Helper. Gave me gas all afternoon. I am usually not a gassy person; it took a great deal of control to slowly release these farts so that they're not audible. Double disturbing. :P

Avoid the tuna casserole unless you're planning on some smelly evil-doing at the office. Allow 2 hours for results.
author: Trixie J.

description:
This place sucks and it has no soul and I'm only giving it a 2nd star because even if it' shit, there are options here you aren't going to find if you're stuck working downtown like me. 

Turkey burger for $4.79 sounds good. Except you get billed $8.50-something for adding avocado, day-old bacon, and a slice of cheddar. Ridiculous. AND, assholes, one spoonful of weak-ass guacamole is not the same as putting some avocado on a sandwich. And your brown-ass lettuce and white-ass tomato aren't helping either. No fries included, no chips, just "here's your suckass $9 burger, make sure to eat a dick on your way out."

The service is slow even when it's not crowded, and they aren't in a particular hurry to give a damn about you. I get the feeling these people have no passion in their lives, no spark, just "well I woke up today and if I make a sandwich I can keep buying these mom jeans at Marshall's and paying rent and then I can die."

Except for the guy on the grill, he seemed to wipe it down between every order. I used to be a grill man. Respect.

Everything here feels like a hotel, or an amusement park restaurant. I bet these people shop at Costco and just schlep this shit around.

If you are a corny office drone you will go here, you will order food, you will get the food you order, you will eat it, you will not die, and you will repeat the process. You will wonder what i am complaining about. 

If you respect style, effort, honesty, and realize that in this city there are a million places to put plants and animals into your stomach, you will never enter.

And the fucking ketchup bottles (big upside-down squeeze kind, also certainly purchased in a two-pack at Costco) were clogged shut, crusty, and empty. Fucking inexcusable for a sandwich joint to have broken ketchup, Fuck.
author: That Was A Good Drum Break ..

description:
We (me & my office mates) eat here ALL the time. There are so many choices and it's always good. Maybe in the course of 5yrs going here there has been 3 bad experiences. Breakfasts are great, lunches are excellent-the food you get for the price you pay is WELL worth it in comparison to some of the rip-off places in this area. 
BIG food, REALLY good Salad bar, great sandwiches - paninis, crepes, hot food, pancakes!  GREAT choices.
author: dawn g.

description:
This is a review on Fountain Cafe's burgers & fries. I ain't much of a salad man. =)

I've had their bacon cheese burger and regular burger with fries. I liked the hamburger meat, buns and bacon. The cheese *sucked*! They use processed American cheese even though he said it was cheddar. NOT! If they used actual cheese that wasn't from a plastic wrapper I betcha it would be way more tasty. 

The fries were good. Fresh, crispy and hot. Yummy! I also like their variety of drinks. I'm such a sucker for sparkling water and I like the 2 sizes of Pelegrino they offer. Mmm!

I also found the restaurant to be quite warm, enough to be somewhat uncomfortable. I actually started to sweat a bit. =(
author: Michael M.

description: Little known: this place has the BEST breakfast burrito!!  Sausage, egg, bacon, potato, salsa.  Simple, classic, perfect proportions...!
author: Flip F.

description: only go here if you want to be treated like crap.  they're rude and think they are better than you.  bleh.
author: Roberta H.

description:
This is one of the better salad bars, with the veggies actually look and taste good.  I like the option of having slices of meat that are actually tasty with your salad.
Some of the entrees that I have tried were actually very good e.g. roasted chicken.

I like the fact that I can get what I want and be out in 5 minutes.

Sometimes the entrees have been warm instead of hot!!! that's why 4 out of 5 stars.
author: Yoddha Y.

description: I got the #3 chicken salad, jack cheese and avocado. They have so many options and I heard a lot of good things about their breakfast burrito, too. I'll definitely have to try that next!
author: Sharon G.

description: When I need a quick and heathy lunch, I come here for the salad bar.  There are a ton of different options, and everything is always fresh.  The place is usually busy, but never so crowded that I feel rushed to select my lunch and I think I've only stood in line to pay maybe twice of the dozen times I've been here, and the line was never more that a three minute wait.
author: Emily V.

description:
Cheap & Good in the FiDi? REALLY? 

Burger is a good buy, Way better then Flames (2 blocks away) 

They also have  "Special Of The Day" and by far the best entree for that is a chicken fried steak and once again lunch for less then 10 bucks with drink in the FiDi is unreal. But you will have to call in and see what the Special Of The Day is.  

Worth checking if your in the area.

Oh yea and they have breakfast ALL DAY!!!!
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Good ole dependable cafeteria type place.  I used to make lunch plans around lasagna Thursdays.  It hits the spot just right for me.  Not an overly fancy Italian iteration of this pasta, but a very businesslike cheesy casserole.  Their turkey sandwich on sourdough roll is also just right with fresh quality fixins to satisfy you on those days when you want something a little lighter for lunch.  (I'm not a salad bar kind of guy...especially when I run the risk of ending up with a $10+ box of lettuce and tomatoes.)
author: Chanson H.

description: I absolutely adore the Fountain Cafe, it saves me during diet time and its super close to work.  Although they have a mexican food stand within the cafe, they have a GREAT, I mean GREAT salad bar that isn't super expensive.  Of course, I'm talking about the whole sans carbs deal.  They often have some good hot food too at the salad bar, but mostly cold.  The heart of palm is really good and they have cubed ham and cheese as well.  I just love this place because I can get small portions of healthy food and not have to spend a sweater's worth of money.
author: Ronjini M.

description: This is one of my go-to lunch places.  They have an awesome variety of sandwiches and the burgers are delicious.  They also have a salad bar and other hot food.  Oh, and a tasty breakfast burrito.  It's cheap, fast, good and the employees are all really nice.  Exactly what I need when I'm on my lunch break!
author: Dana G.

description:
A couple co-workers and myself were just in the mood for some quick breakfast, so we decided to try this place out.

By the looks of it, it just looks like your typical crappy cafe with mediocre food, so I guess I had real low expectations for it.  I decided to go for the Pancake Special with an egg and some bacon.  Wow, was I surprised!  I'm really not a pancake person, and it's rare that I find a place that serves flapjacks that appeal to my tastebuds.  But theirs were really good.  Plus the bacon was cooked just right and my egg over easy was perfect.  And it was only $7!

If you're looking for a cheap and satisfying breakfast, come here.  I'll have to try their lunch menu next time, but I hear it gets real busy around then.
author: Jonathan B.

description: We used Fountain Cafe for a huge corporate breakfast catering order, and we could not have had a better experience. They were great to work with both in planning and executing the event: extremely helpful, responsive, detailed and gave lots of good tips and guidance when placing a first time order with them. The food was delicious - we have a lot of different companies in the area cater to our business but this was definitely a highlight, employees were asking where it was from to go on their own time! Cannot go wrong with their breakfast burritos! Thanks so much Fountain Cafe!
author: Kacey B.

description: Been working in fidi for 2 months and this is the best lunch place I've found so far.  The chicken panini rocks - the balsamic vinegar is a nice touch and it makes the sandwich. They also have a big salad bar which I've been told is good, but haven't tried it yet.  People that work there are friendly too.
author: Christine K.

description:
sandwiches were sub-par.  used pretty low quality meats and the bread wasnt that great either.  And it took literally forever for my sandwich to come out.  

I'd try the salad bar next time but for some reason I think it'll be hard for me to be impressed cuz Ive had Draeger's salad bar.
author: Peggy W.

description:
I love Fountain Cafe. The staff is really helpful and nice. 

I order food from Fountain all the time. They have great BLT's, Chicken Salad Sandwiches, Breakfast, etc.

They participate in the Galleria Frequent buyer stamp program. Problem is prices are very cheap that i'm always below $6.00 to even get a stamp.

LOVE IT.
author: J-nine I.

description:
A good place to remember what the rest of the country eats for lunch, as opposed to $10 organic sustainable salads w/tofu.

A hankering for a good old-fashioned grilled cheese sandwich led me here for lunch. They had a pretty large menu, but for this kind of place, don't reach too far.  I really don't get why people order healthy food, fancy food or seafood at psuedo-greasy spoons. Really.
