My larger than average sandwich, fries and fountain Diet coke set me back about 7 dollars, which is a touch too much for this kind of fare but it totally hit the spot. Too bad it's in a mall.
author: jessica s.

description:
The BEST turkey burger in the city, bar none.  Unfortunately, I don't work downtown anymore, and every time I've been by during my shopping hours they are closed.  Their salad bar is delicious as well, but it's easy to go overboard and find yourself with a 50# salad.  Yikes.  Their other entrees are hit or miss, sometimes it's a delicious meal, sometimes it's only ok.  I've never had any terrible meals here though.

However, there are some problems.  First off, I've obliquely mentioned their hours, which I've never bothered to actually figure out, but I assume they are only open for business day lunchtime.  Then there is their ordering system, which is complete chaos.  I have no idea how they have never screwed up my order, but I have seen several people get theirs messed up.  It's also above average price wise, so it's no bargain lunch.

A side bonus to ordering here is being able to take your lunch up to the roof of the Crocker Galleria and eat in relative peace.  It's rarely crowded, and usually sunny up there, so it's a nice lunch break from a busy day.
author: Gusty S.

description: I was in the mood for a real grilled cheese sandwich and Fountain Cafe blew it away!  I ended up ordering a grilled ham and cheese with fries and it was really, really good and only $8.35 for a huge sandwich and pile of freshly made fries.  The other food and salad bar looked equally tempting and I saw one of the hamburgers which was huge and looked really good. I'll be back.  This is a find in the financial district if you want comfort food.
author: Nicholette M.

description:
Fountain Cafe is good because it's inside Crocker Galleria and it's inexpensive.  These are the only two redeeming qualities of this establishment.

I got one of the 'the specials' today - poached salmon with mashed potatoes and salad.  It was a lot of food for $7.50, but none of it was any good.  The salmon was dry and cold, mashed potatoes were mealy and tasteless, and caesar salad was soggy and drenched in dressing.  

I was lucky enough to get some fruit salad which was also soggy and not particularly fresh.  Besides, the fruit salad and the caesar salad in my to-go box became more than friends very quickly.  Have you ever had a piece of honeydew covered in parmesan cheese and caesar dressing?  Yum!  Actually, it was pretty disgusting.

Their salad bar seems pretty decent, though, although not spectacular.

Go at your own risk!
author: Yan G.

description:
Meh. 

I've eaten several times, samping their salad bar (decent) to sandwiches (more miss than hit) - this is just average. The are quite a few vegetarian options available (falafel, grilled cheese, veggie burger), but nothing to really write home about. 

The only thing that really spins my wheels here is the avocado sandwich on sourdough roll - the roll is just about chewy and the avocado is generous enough to make it enjoyable.
author: Sean G.

description: Gross omelet (half melted cheese), cold potatoes,  okay pancakes.  Would not eat there again.
author: John T.

description:
The only thing good here are the sandwiches.  The salad bar has fallen drastically on my rating chart.   Thier hot food is pretty decent except for the lasagna...not good.   They do have grilled chicken and steamed veggies w/ herbs. 

They have hummus....I love hummus. 

They minus another star because the place is humid and smells like the grilled hamburgers they make.
author: Jay H.

description:
On a day when I needed comfort in its most pure, creamy, ideal state, this place served me a monster portion of mac and cheese in a friendly manner, provided hot crushed red pepper flakes (die, taste buds DIE!), and charged me less than $5 including tax.  Take that Assqew.

My classmates and I were waiting around the top of the escalators at the Crocker Galleria, being a general nuisance and fire hazard.  Unable to wait any longer (it wasn't getting any hotter after all), I dug in to the take-away container of gooey-ness.  At least 4 grown up people oogled my dish with pleasant surprise and asked me if that was mac and cheese in the tone usually reserved for, "Is that really a Prada bag on sale for 90% off?"  I felt quite smug and self satisfied with my choice of nourishment and the lunch world around this BART station opened up a little more.  

The other offerings on the menu were at very decent prices and I saw the portions they offered.  It was decent.  Very decent.  Not obesity-generous but not the usual yuppie salad bar nouveau cuisine of "Good Omens"  It was enough for grown men to have a satisfying meal without the burden of having leftovers to take home or the angst of throwing perfectly good food away.  

I'll be back to try their grilled sandwiches.  When the temperature takes a nose-dive and the weather is on the rag, nothing warms that void where my heart should be like a grilled sandwich with turkey and sprouts. 

Did I mention that half a roast chicken was only going to cost $4.50?  You could pay $4.50 for half a roast chicken, or for ONE grilled chicken breast.  Which would you chose?  Depends if you're on Atkins or not!
author: Christina C.

description: Good food, good quality, fast service. I work nearby so it's nice to have a place that's very efficient and even let's you call in orders. Wide selection of food items. I recommend the mac n cheese if they have it. The turkey burger is also pretty good. You can expect to pay $5-$8 for a lunch. The crepes are average.
author: Tushar K.

description:
I didn't give Fountain 5 stars because whenver I leave that place, I end up smelling like a grilled cheese sandwich - especially at the lunch rush.
However, after an eventful Thursday night out, a breakfast sandwich with egg, sausage, cheese and jam on wheat hits the spiggity spot at 9am on a Friday morning.
author: Leslie G.

description:
This is the best place to get a salad because you can put whatever the hell you want on it.  They charge by weight, so you don't feel bad if you just want a little bit.  

I wish I took my lunches earlier, because then I'd be able to try their daily specials.  I avoid the financial district lunch hour because it usually means that it takes longer to get my food than the time I have left to eat.  By 2:30 the specials are all gone!  But they have hearty sandwiches and their burgers aren't bad.  

The main reason I come here is for the salad bar...but if it's a hot day out, get there early because most of the good salad toppers are gone.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Yucky expensive grilled cheese sandwich!  I read one review that the grilled cheese was good and it's total crap.  For $5, it was a simple grilled cheese but the worst part was it was totally flattened and then they put a pickle on top and wrapped it w/ sandwich paper.  I open my sandwich and the bread was slightly soaked with pickle juice.

I also made a salad and didn't realise they charged $6.95/lb!  My small salad was another $4!!!  Outrageous!!  Yes, the salad bar is fresh but I could get a large pre-made salad for a better price.  Aiya!!
author: J B.

description: I would say 2 stars but everything else in the Galleria food court is such a letdown that I'm giving this 3 stars because the salad bar is pretty good and the cooked food is okay.  I had a pretty tasty create-your-own salad (the dolmas were a great plus since a salad can be a weak lunch), and one time I tried the chicken enchiladas with Spanish rice.  It was so-so; the guy who served it was really nice.
author: Molly P.

description: It doesn't matter if it's Thanksgiving or the middle of August, cranberry and turkey just go together exceptionally well. Especially on wheat rolls. Kudos to the Fountain Cafe for offering just that, along with an unexpected dill pickle on the side. Walking back to the office, it was the perfect snack to hold me over until I could devour this sandwich goodness.
author: Jason B.

description: yet another 3 star Crocker establishment (if i could though - id give them 3.5). The positives here are several, #1 best salad bar in croker (by best i mean only), which is not saying much because even something like Julies kitchen, i think, offers better variety, #2 generally the place seems pretty efficient, and #3 looks like their employees care more about good customer service more than your average aloof chinese restaurant staff like lets say new ming's, 2 blocks away.
author: Oleg H.

description: I would just like to mention that the ordering online service is awesome! Being that I tend a store in the galleria, I don't have time to wait for my food to be cooked.  It's so easy to order online and go grab it real quick!  Not to mention, they are open early, have a great breakfast menu, tons of vegetarian options, reasonable prices... and friendly staff!
author: Kate M.

description: MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM...the chicken cheesesteak and perfectly cooked french fries.  Very inexpensive.  I love!
author: Jennifer T.

description: This was the real low-point of our San Francisco dining experience.  We needed an early breakfast, and thought we would be better off at a restaurant than with roomservice, but this place was pretty bad.  Weird, dry scrambled eggs, bad coffee, instant hot chocolate and no poached eggs (even though they were on the menu).  This place would probably get 3 stars anywhere else, but for San Francisco, it's only 2.
author: Eleanor K.

description: I can make a tasty, fresh, large salad here for around three dollars. Enough said. My wife has gotten some of the sandwiches and has not been disappointed. One day I'll make it over to try the breakfast.
author: Winton W.

description:
[review no. 50]

                                      @              Fountain Cafe             @
                                       WWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW

After being sent on my merry way from Nichols Research for a consumer panel discussion (which I was handsomely paid $125 for not participating)  on 44 Montgomery Street~~~I sauntered over to the Crocker Galleria to see the new Under One Roof Christmas Shoppe.  The aroma of the third floor had me floating on the escalator and into Fountain Cafe.   Reading the 49 reviews prior to my writing, I was glad I dropped in before the Noon crowd.  I checked out the menu and the price as well as their Grille and their well stocked salad bar.  If I was still in the work force, this place would be a "habit" for me.  The burgers looked delish, but I settled for their Fish n' Chip ($6.50).    I like my fish batter to be coated with flour, milk and eggs (like Picadilly Fish n' Chip).  The batter was a bread type so it was tasty but I like crispy to the max.  As one reviewer wrote the Fries was tops ($1.75 if you don't order an entree special with it).    An open call to Yelpers in the FiDi, I would love to meet up for lunch here if you want company.
author: Marian G.

description: I so miss working next to the Galleria and eating at the Fountain every day. I maintain that the Fountain's salad bar is the best downtown - it's got everything, even hearts of palm, which I go crazy for. Now if you're into lots of non-salad-ingredient-type-ingredients-like-lasagna-or-stir-fry-veggies, well go to Lightening Foods or something. This place is for salad lovers only. And it's a good place for lunch dates because there's a grill and tons of delish non-salad options. Lot's of good indoor/outdoorish seating options, too. The only drawback is that it seems like it's always about a million degrees in there. 5 years of coming here and still can't figure that out.
author: Mandy Z.

description:
I eat here about once a week. The quality of the food is good, as well as consistent. They have a large variety to choose from. As a creature of habit, I always get the chicken sandwich (I think they call it chicken steak) and fries. The seasoning is so good! The place is packed, but the service is fast.

They also have breakfast, which is nice if you have time to sit down.
author: Mel C.

description: This is a great place to eat at if you work in the FIDI. They have alot of different foods to choose from. Can be a little pricey.
author: Shanika M.

description: This is my favorite place to eat at the crocker galleria.  The ingredients are fresh and I don't feel gross after eating there.  You can get a modestly priced sandwich made to order, hot dishes, or visit the salad bar.  They are one of the few places that still offer breakfast foods at lunch.
author: angela k.

description: Tucked away in the Crocker Galleria food court, I used to go to this place all the time when I worked next door. My four star rating is purely for the french fries. What a bargain!  They're only a $1.75 and they make you a huge batch that come out fresh, crispy and hot out of the fryer! I'm not sure there's a better bargain for deliciously fresh french fries anywhere in the Financial District.
author: Jeff L.

description: Great breakfasts.  I love their variety.  I used to get the strawberry crepes with whipped cream.  Love, love, love it.
author: L. A.  W.

description: Good grilled cheese and fries. I like that they use real plates if you get it for there.
author: Elsa E.

description: this place is pretty good for going to grab some lunch during work. Very good cheese steak sandwiches, salad bar, soups, and the #8 sandwich is prettttty good as well. There burgers are ok.. except for last time I ordered one the bun got super soggy and i pretty much ate a bunless burger.
author: Viv D.

description: Wonderful breakfast spot in the city. Super cheap and you can order online. I wish this place was in the east bay! And they have breakfast until 330 PM?  What a deal!!!
author: Tahiya C.

description: I'd love it if i could understand the man when he was telling me they were out of hamburger meat..  so anyway, once i figured it out, I ordered a tuna sandwich instead, with fries and a diet coke.  The tuna was bland, could have used some salt, but there was a salt shaker there, so i guess i was expected to fix that problem myself.  I later said "those fries weren't as good as mcdonalds"... which is sad.  I've heard this place has good pancakes... but I don't like pancakes... so... that's a pathetic 2 stars for Fountain Cafe.
author: Caleb D.

description: This place is pretty good, especially if you work around the area.  The employees are really sweet and nice, THOUGH I am a bit upset because they messed up twice on two different phone orders, but I'm not surprised because I guess PLAIN just goes in one ear and out the other everywhere.  Besides the misunderstandings I really do like this place, they have one of the best tuna melts :) and I love their grilled cheeses.  My co-worker always orders a Philly so those should be really good too.  Also, they have some great breakfast choices because I've had plenty of b-fast burrito's and omelet's in the area, but where else can you get some Short Stacks and French Toast!? & if you're trying to cut back on calories and want something healthy for the morning I'd suggest their Spinach omelet w/ egg whites and Toast.  I really love parfaits but if you like yours with a sweeter taste or strawberry, you should go elsewhere, Fountain does theirs with plaint non fat yogurt which is a lot healthier for you and if you haven't tried it unsweetened you might find it a bit sour!
author: Christina O.

description: Fountain Cafe has everything you need for lunch. They serve hot food, breakfast eggs and burritos, sandwiches, soups and salads. If you want fresh ceaser salad, they will make it for you. You want to add chicken to your salad, it's freshly grilled. You ask for extra bread, it's free. Service is fast and operative. Good place for lunch in Crocker Galleria.
author: Michael K.

description: They have the best salad bar  (way better than another lunch place Lee's).  An interesting menu  (french toast, burgers, sandwiches, roast chicken, lasagna).  It's cheap, fast, and yummy in my tummy. Sometimes you just need salad with a side of fries.
author: Liz O.

description: The food can be good or bad depending what you get.  For the most part, it's decent.  Just don't get the crepes.  They're not good at all.  Our office frequently goes here to get breakfast take out.  The eggs are pretty standard.  Pancakes and french toast are standard.  Potatoes and hashbrowns aren't the best.  My coworkers really like the breakfast burritos.  I had a cheeseburger with avocado here before and it was pretty good.  The salad bar is pretty good.  Haven't tried the pastas and dishes during lunch, but they look good.  The fresh squeezed OJ is good.  I would give the quality of the food here 3.5 stars out of 5, but the variety makes it a 4.  Prices are also decent.  Not super cheap, but not super pricey either.  Pretty much what you would expect in the financial district.
author: Ada K.

description: Mmmm, the garden veggie burger is delish.  I got fries on the side with it and they were sooo good!  I love fries that are not oozing w/grease and have that slightly crispy texture w/softness on the inside, they actually make you believe that you're not eating unhealthy.  The prices are very reasonable and great if you're on a budget and want to get your money's worth.  My total was just under $7 with tax.  I'm really looking forward to going back and trying more on the menu, especially since they have several veggie options, another bonus.
author: Swetha G.

description: I'm a big fan of salad bars and this one is pretty damn good. They mix it up enough for me to be happy, something that salad bars rarely achieve. It's also fairly cheap as long as you don't load up on the super heavy stuff (aka overly large melon slices -- resist!).
author: Ali L.

description:
two words: SALAD BAR!

the goods:
hummus, pitas, and falafel are part of the salad bar

the bads:
my salads weigh 14lbs and cost more than any lunch ever should.
author: Helen N.

description: I get breakfast here (to-go) pretty much every day M-F, and it's definitely the best breakfast in the financial district.  It's very consistent and also reasonably priced. I recommend the eggs with hash browns and toast -- you can't go wrong!
author: Jason G.

description: I've only ever gotten sandwiches and fries here but they are decent for the price! I get the tuna sandwich every couple of weeks and I'm kind of picky about how I like tuna salad.  The Fountain's tuna is not trying too hard to be fancy, like the tuna at Boudin's... no celery or diced onion and its a pretty good portion too! The fries are good and seemingly fresh but sometimes when I order too late in the day, not so much.
author: Shannon A.

description: What a bust.  I had a Groupon-y thing worth $16 that I paid $8 for, but would definitely not return without a similar coupon.  Lunch for two was $19.  I had a salad, my friend had a chicken cheese steak thing, and we shared a bottle of water.  Totally not worth it for the sub-par food.
author: Olivia T.

description: It's no Mixt Greens, but it has a decent salad bar, helpful employees and reasonable prices.  I don't really know what more I could ask for.
author: Kyla B.

description: Loooove fountain!!  The employees are super friendly and remember your name, the turkey burgers and tuna melts are awsome, meatloaf and tuna casserole make me cry tears of joy...hells yeah I'll be back!!
author: Rena H.

description:
This review is for the salad bar only!

The salad bar is awesome!! they have a couple prepared salads such as pesto pasta salad, curry pasta chicken salad, couscous, potatoes..etc. But the selection of salad choices is the best I've seen. They offer 3 types of lettuce, green/red peppers, cheeses, pumpkin seeds/almonds, chicken, tuna, onions, chickpeas/kidneybeans, corn, peas, and the list goes on. In addition, they have an extension to their salad bar that has at least 15+ dressings in all different flavours and offered in low fat/full fat forms. 

At around 6 dollars a pound the salad adds up depending on what you put in it, but it's cheaper than most in the area.
author: Florence T.

description: I really like the Fountain cafe for a tasty lunch. I have tried two different sandwiches now and they were both good. They have a wide variety of lunch items such as: cold sandwiches, hot sandwiches, salad bar, breakfast items, and hot lunch. The lady next to me last time that I went had the french toast and it smelled really good! Maybe I'll try it next time...
author: Carly W.

description: When I went here I ordered the hot pastromi sandwich, with fries. THe pricing was okay. The meat was extremely tough and not enjoyable. The service left a lot to be desired as well.
author: Kyle L.

description: I work close by the Galleria, and after browsing the site I found Fountain Cafe. I love sandwich's and there #9- Turkey, Avocado, Cream Cheese & Sprouts sounded very tasty. The sandwich plus a can of soda was under $8, which was what I wanted to pay, and the sandwich was as good as I was hoping for. The only downside is that the Galleria can get pretty crowded during the lunch hours and finding a seat can be a pain- but I'll most definitely be returning to Fountain!
author: vanessa g.

description: If you work in the area, this should be your go-to default lunch spot.  Plenty to choose from ranging from sandwichesfish, chips and a salad bar, of course.
author: Jon P.

description: Best salad bar I've found in the area of Montgomery and Market.  Plus, they serve breakfast, they have great fries, and they can grill up just about anything.
author: Dave M.

description: they cover the basics in a good way.  the salad bar, i'm told, is fabulous, but i have a phobia about salad bars so i can't really vouch for it.  but it looks ok.  i mean, i haven't seen anything crawl out of it or into it, i just don't like salad bars.  so sue me.  don't sue me, i don't have any money.  that is also why i go here.  it is relatively cheap and if you can't figure out what you really want for lunch, relatively cheap is a good thing.
author: Samantha W.

description: i got the #9 sandwich which is a turkey, avocado, cream cheese, and sprouts. sOOoo good.. i never really had a sandwich with cream cheese and it was delicious.. very good combination! the only thing that sucked was it took forever to make.. well i was at lunch rush hour too.. so i guess that would explain it.. but still.. plus it was WAY too hot in there.. no air circulation what so ever!! hotness and smell of food mixed together.. no bueno!! :)
author: Jenn T.

description: i come here to eat breakfast.  i usually get the pancakes with bacon and an egg.  they have good crepes as well.  you get a hefty meal.
author: con c.

description: I love Fountain Cafe's proximity to my place of employment. Great lunch spot, fabulous salad bar (they ran out of croutons once, that makes me sad but it hasn't happened since--and they have a really good creamy caeser dressing) they have cool daily specials that are adequate comfort food fare: ribs, macaroni & cheese, mashed potatoes, roasted chicken, lasagna. They have a decent chili (even better if you stock up on the free crackers at the condiment bar--and don't forget to pile on the cheese!). They have yummy grilled cheese sandwiches (served with a pickle slice--bonus!) and they do breakfast too! They have okay burgers and fish & chips. Not the best but they won't make you sick or anything. For a burger I prefer to spend a bit more and walk the extra 2 blocks to Bistro Burger. I have to thank Fountain Cafe, though, for being my go-to spot for lunch when I can't make up my mind and don't want to be let down. If you're one of those people who HAS to take their lunch right at 12:00 PM on the dot, then call in your order. This place is an absolute zoo during the weekday lunch rush. The employees handle it well, though, or else I would never have the patience. Thanks for being competent, people. So appreciated.
author: Magi C.

description: I love the salad bar here. It is one of the best in the financial in my opinion. Really other good hot food too. Only problem has been a couple times they have accidently overcharged me and it was an absolute pain trying to get reimbursed. Love the food, just always check your bill!
author: A D.

description: great place to have lunch with coworkers.. variety of food choices...they have breakfast all day.. prices are reasonable.. their sandwhiches are huge..
author: Lily T.
